kickstart.post:
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance vm-container \ membership='VM Container' node='client' graph='default' public='yes'
# managed appliance /opt/rocks/bin/rocks set appliance attr vm-container managed true
# set the kvm attribute # this can be used to disable kvm bridging on a frontend with kvm # in case the user does not want to have VM stuff on the frontend /opt/rocks/bin/rocks set appliance attr vm-container kvm true /opt/rocks/bin/rocks set host attr &Kickstart_PublicHostname; kvm true
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance hosted-vm \ membership='Hosted VM' public='no'
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add host attr localhost airboss localhost
#this is used to install virtual frontend /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add bootaction action="install vm frontend" \ kernel="/boot/kickstart/default/vmlinuz-&rocks_version;-&arch;" \ ramdisk="/boot/kickstart/default/initrd.img-&rocks_version;-&arch;" \ args="ramdisk_size=150000 lang= devfs=nomount pxe kssendmac selinux=0 noipv6 ks=http://&Kickstart_PublicHostname;/install/sbin/kickstart.cgi ksdevice=eth1 build airboss=localhost"
#set the cpu_model to pass-though this will get the most of the virtual cpu /opt/rocks/bin/rocks set attr cpu_mode host-passthrough
